snippet: The Supreme Court questioned lawyers about whether the Town of Greece, N.Y., violated the Constitution in opening board meetings with mostly Christian prayers.
abstract: Supreme Court hears arguments on whether upstate town of Greece, NY, crossed constitutional line by opening its Town Board meetings with mostly Christian prayers; justices appear to find issue unusually complex, with several suggesting in questioning that there may be no satisfactory principled answer.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court questioned lawyers about whether the Town of Greece, N.Y., violated the Constitution in opening board meetings with mostly Christian prayers.

headline.main: Justices Weigh Constitutionality of New York Town’s Prayers
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Hears Arguments on Constitutionality of Prayers at Town’s Meetings
